column4: Hey everyone, I've upgraded to the latest ubuntu version (finally) on my home desktop computer and I'm having the two following issues: 1. files and folders are shown on my desktop, since I have tons of files and folders in my home directory this looks very cluttered and I want to just hide them. 2. Flash seems to have some sort of hardware acceleration bug and sometimes swaps the blue and red channels on youtube
re 1 I suggest you move them under Documents
so there is no way to turn off viewing at all, eh? That kinda sucks, but I guess I cam move stuff around.
ur personal files? just Ctrl+A  & Ctrl+X & paste them under Documtns
its just that I have hard coded paths in scripts and stuff, but I guess I can do that
so it might breaks the links?! mmh; can't help with that but i guess u will have to correct them
yeah, no worries, I'll just write a script and pattern match :)

I solved it! I remembered about .hidden files hiding stuff from you in the GUI file browser, so I added every filename into the .hidden file and then clicked on the desktop and ^r'ed and they all vanished :D
great :D I've never heard of this; can u provide a link about it?
this is the best I could find http://linux.about.com/library/gnome/blgnome6n6r.htm
ah I already knew this lol; thanks anyways
I usually don;t use it since I have hidden files always shown
Ahhh, see, I almost always use the keyboard in Terminal since using the mouse hurts my arm, so I really have very little use for GUI based stuff in the first place
